data.title: Happy workforce
data.meta_description: A morning on the gallops with Sir Michael Stoute is a sport in itself, a cross between cat and mouse and Traffic Cops. One minute the trainer is there, supervising his string, arms akimbo, eyes
data.text:
A morning on the gallops with Sir Michael Stoute is a sport in itself, a cross between cat and mouse and Traffic Cops. One minute the trainer is there, supervising his string, arms akimbo, eyes alert; the next he has vanished, leaving only clear Newmarket air and fading guffaws of laughter.

Occasionally, he will cast the odd scrap of information in the general direction of the tape recorders — nothing too revealing. Stoute is aware of the need to service his owners and, to a much lesser extent, the press, but he will do it on his terms. With his fifth Derby winner safely banked and an 11th trainer’s title on the horizon, the WG Grace of racing has more than earned the right to
